Final Project: Diamonds

Celine Shenny, Carolina Minami Oguchi

Diamonds are shimmering gemstones that have a largely arbitrary value and yet its allure is universal. Many cultures use them to portray the value of love, strength, and magic. Diamonds have become popular since the 19th century due to its improved cutting and polishing techniques. The value of the stone comes from its unique appearance, strength and relative rarity.
